member.name: M:Presentation.Controllers.ClientRegistrationController.RegisterClient(Shared.DataTransferObject.ClientIdentityDTOs.ClientRegisterDTO)
member.summary: Initiates the client registration process by creating an unconfirmed user and sending OTP verification.
member.remarks: This endpoint creates a user with unconfirmed email status and sends an OTP for verification. The user cannot login until the OTP is verified via the VerifyOtp endpoint.
member.param: Client registration data including name, email, phone number, and password.
member.returns: Returns OTP response with success status and verification instructions.
member.response: Returns when registration is initiated successfully and OTP is sent
Returns when validation fails (invalid data format)
Returns when email or phone number already exists
Returns when internal server error occurs

member.name: M:Presentation.Controllers.ClientRegistrationController.ConfirmEmail(Shared.DataTransferObject.OtpDTOs.OtpVerificationDTO)
member.summary: Completes the client registration process by verifying the OTP and activating the user account.
member.remarks: This endpoint verifies the OTP code (valid only for 3 minutes) sent to the user's email and activates the previously created user account. Upon successful verification, the user's email is confirmed and they are assigned the Client role.
member.param: OTP verification data containing email and OTP code.
member.returns: Returns complete client profile with authentication tokens.
member.response: Returns when OTP is verified successfully and user is activated
Returns when no user found with the provided email
Returns when OTP is invalid or expired
Returns when internal server error occurs

member.name: M:Presentation.Controllers.ClientRegistrationController.ResendOtp(Shared.DataTransferObject.OtpDTOs.ResendOtpRequestDTO)
member.summary: Resends OTP to the user's email for registration completion.
member.remarks: This endpoint resends OTP code to unverified email addresses for users who haven't completed registration. The OTP can only be resent after 60 seconds have passed since the last OTP was sent. If the email is already verified or an OTP was sent recently, appropriate errors will be returned.
member.returns: Returns OTP response with success status and message
member.response: Returns when OTP is resent successfully
Returns when no user found with the provided email
Returns when email is already verified
Returns when OTP was sent recently (within 60 seconds)
Returns when internal server error occurs

member.name: M:Presentation.Controllers.LoginController.Login(Shared.DataTransferObject.LoginDTOs.LoginDTO)
member.summary: Authenticates a user and returns JWT token with user information.
member.remarks: This endpoint handles user authentication for both clients and technicians. Returns appropriate status codes for different authentication states.
member.param: Login credentials containing phone number and password
member.returns: Returns user data with JWT token on successful authentication
member.response: Returns when login is successful with user data and JWT token
Returns when client email is not verified
Returns when technician account is pending admin approval
Returns when technician account is rejected by admin
Returns when internal server error occurs
